title: Amazon KDP Niche Research: Find Profitable Keywords & Niches

tactics.name: Keyword Rank Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword demand using bestseller rank and product count
steps: Check Amazon search results for product count and average rank
Use Publisher Rocket for automated analysis
caveats: Competitive niches below 10,000 BSR require stronger differentiation
source_quotes: I like to see a rank of anywhere between 10,000 to 100,000
products plus average rank equals relevant keywords

tactics.name: keyword stem creation
tactics.description: combines overlapping keywords into a longtail keyword for backend use
steps: use autosuggest to find overlapping terms
source_quotes: I try to find any keyword that has some type of overlap

tactics.name: author_name_research
tactics.description: Select a relatable author name targeting a specific age demographic by combining popular names and testing for uniqueness.
steps: Look up popular names from a specific decade (e.g., 2000s) for target audience resonance
Test name combinations via Google search to avoid existing authors
Use pen name generator tools when stuck on last names

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize niche
source_quotes: low review counts indicate underserved niches

heuristics.name: exact match prioritization
heuristics.condition: If keyword has high specificity then boost
source_quotes: one two three of your keyword phrases... should be an exact match

claims.statement: Amazon KDP bestseller rank thresholds between 10,000-100,000 indicate viable niches
source_quotes: I like to see a rank of anywhere between 10,000 to 100,000

claims.statement: Authors can use pen names to avoid brand dilution
source_quotes: I'm not gonna use my own name... to avoid muddying my brand

claims.statement: Read Z provides a pen name generator tool for author name creation.
source_quotes: I ended up going over to the fine folks of read Z they actually have a pen name generator

niche_patterns.description: Combine demographic identity with specific problem and unique constraint
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates hyper-targeted niches with clear demand signals
source_quotes: if you try to write for everyone you write for no one
compile a list of common keyword phrases
